entry.title: SAP Datasphere ‚Äì Existing Connections Suddenly Stopped Working After Cloud Connector Upgrade
entry.content:
Good day,

I hope someone can help me with the following issue.

In my company we use SAP Datasphere, and we already had three connections created. These connections had been working perfectly for a long time, and I was able to create Replication Flows and other objects consuming data from our source system (SAP S/4HANA).

However, two days ago all three connections suddenly stopped working. They are no longer usable, as shown in Image (1), where you can see the same error displayed for all three connections.

Our Basis support team tried upgrading the Cloud Connector to the latest available version, as shown in Image (2), but unfortunately this did not solve the issue.

We would appreciate any guidance or suggestions to help us resolve this problem.

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Re: Move SU with multiple item problem
entry.content:
A total of six enhancements must be implemented in the main program SAPML03T in order to pass the determined values to the main program SAPLL03B.

Includes to Enhance (implizit):

- ML03TFHU_LENUM_EINL_CHECK
- ML03TF20_T333_LESEN
- ML03TFBM_LEQUANTS_INT_LTAP
- ML03TF20_T340D_LESEN
- MLLVSFOR - FORM T340_LESEN
- ML03TF50_DATEN_LTAP_MLVS

Example in ML03TFBM_LEQUANTS_INT_LTAP:

* QUANTO Sebastian Wachter 06.11.2025 Daten korrekt anderem Rahmenprogramm bei externem Aufruf √ºbergeben
FIELD-SYMBOLS <INT_LTAP> TYPE ANY TABLE.
ASSIGN ('(SAPLL03B)INT_LTAP[]') TO <INT_LTAP>.
IF <INT_LTAP> IS ASSIGNED.
IF <INT_LTAP>[] IS INITIAL.
<INT_LTAP>[] = INT_LTAP[].
ENDIF.
ENDIF.

Example in ML03TF20_T333_LESEN:
* QS S.Wachter 06.11.2025 In anderem Rahmenprogramm Daten korrekt setzen
FIELD-SYMBOLS <t333> TYPE any.
ASSIGN ('(SAPLL03B)T333') TO <t333>.
IF <t333> IS ASSIGNED.
IF <t333> IS INITIAL.
<t333> = t333.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.

entry.title: Issue in SAP MDK Data Table Control ‚Äì setValue() Not Working
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on the SAP MDK Data Table control, where I need to set the value of one column based on the user-entered value in another column. The edit mode is set to Inline.

On the Save button, I have added the following rule to set the status:

let currentCell = context.getPageProxy().getControl('SectionedTable0').getSection('SectionDataTable0').getCell(0, 0);
const newValue = "Accepted";
currentCell.setValue(newValue);


I have referred to the following blog, but this approach doesn‚Äôt seem to work. I would appreciate any help or suggestions on this issue.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/what-s-new-in-mobile-development-kit-client-23-4/ba-p/13557735

 

I also tried the below code snippet, but it did not work either:

let currentCell = context.getControl('SectionedTable0').getSection('SectionDataTable0').getCell(0, 0);
const newValue = "My Product";
currentCell.setValue(newValue);

 


Thank you in advance for your help!
@bill_froelich 
@Jitendra_Kansal78

entry.title: Re: Working with the new My Timesheet App Version 4 (F3074A) and tasks time-reporting in PPM Project
entry.content:
Is it possible to enter the time directly on the PPM tasks in the app or CAT2??

In standard, for the timesheet to be submitted on PPM tasks, we need to assign/plan resources on the roles against the task and then it appears in the worklist of CAT2 from where you can book the hours. 
 
However,  We have many resources which can't be planned on PPM projects in advance. This unplanned resources will still need to book hours on tasks.
When we try to manually assign the task in CAT2, the system doesnt make the PPM project or task editable even though they are made as input field in the field selection config of data entry profile.
Neither we are able to add task manually in the assignment in the app.

Appreciate your help!

entry.title: OData Service FAA_ASSET_OVERVIEWPAGE (Entity Set C_AssetBalanceOverviewResult)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

When trying to fetch data from the entity set C_AssetBalanceOverviewResult of the OData service FAA_ASSET_OVERVIEWPAGE, I encountered an issue related to the input parameters.

The service metadata for C_AssetBalanceOverviewParameters exposes the following parameters:
P_CompanyCode
P_CurrencyRole
P_FiscalPeriod
P_FiscalYear
P_Ledger
However, in the underlying CDS Data Definition C_AssetBalanceOverview, I see additional parameters:
define view C_AssetBalanceOverview
with parameters
P_TodayDate : fagl_keydate,
P_AssetAccountingKeyFigureSet : faa_key_figure_set,
P_CompanyCode : fis_bukrs,
P_Ledger : fis_rldnr,
P_FiscalYear : fis_ryear,
P_FiscalPeriod : fis_poper,
P_CurrencyRole : fis_curtp,
P_FiscalPeriodEndDate : fagl_keydate (derived automatically)

The parameters P_TodayDate and P_AssetAccountingKeyFigureSet are marked with @Consumption.hidden, so they are not visible in the OData metadata.

When I call the OData service and provide only the visible parameters:
P_CompanyCode
P_CurrencyRole
P_FiscalPeriod
P_FiscalYear
P_Ledger
I receive a short dump: CX_SADL_DUMP_APPL_MODEL_ERROR in object FAA_ASSET_OVERVIEWPAGE.

Question:

  1. Are the parameters being passed correctly according to the design of this CDS consumption view and OData service?

  2. How should the hidden parameters (P_TodayDate and P_AssetAccountingKeyFigureSet) be handled when calling the OData service?

  3. Is there a known workaround or recommended approach to avoid the CX_SADL_DUMP_APPL_MODEL_ERROR for this scenario?

Any guidance or reference documentation would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: How to Create a Tile Pointing to dynamic URL : S/4Hana
entry.content:
Hello @Jocelyn_Dart  

We have a similar requirement where we would like to create Tiles in S/4 Fiori Launchpad (2023 Private Cloud) for custom CAP apps deployed in BTP. 

I did the below steps:

  1. SM59 --> Defined new RFC type G "TEST_BTP2FLP_G" pointing to host of BTP 
  2. SM30 -> /UI2/V_SYSALIAS --> Defined new Sys Alias "TEST_BTP" 
  3. SM30 -> /UI2/V_ALIASMAP --> Defined new Alias mapping using Source = "TEST_BTP" and Target = "TEST_BTP2FLP"
  4. /IWFND/ROUTING -> added entry using System Alias = "TEST_BTP2FLP" and RFC destination = "TEST_BTP2FLP_G" 
  5. Created target mapping with fixed part of URL and Alias = "TEST_BTP"
  6. Create Tile for the sem obj and action defined in step 5

When opening the Tile, it goes to a URL constructed as <S/4_HOST>/FIXED_URL instead of going to <BTP_HOST>/FIXED_URL. 

Do you have any documentation on how should we do this kind of integration? Customer would like to have a single entry point for all the apps. 

Thank you!

Lucian

entry.title: Impact of rfc/callback_security_method Setting on Optimizer Functionality
entry.content:
We are experiencing issues with the parameter rfc/callback_security_method currently set to 3 in our SAP RISE environment.
Problem:

When the parameter is set to 3, the RCC_VERSION transaction and RCCF TM Optimizer do not work as expected.
The system generates an ABAP short dump with error:
CALLBACK_REJECTED_BY_WHITELIST
RFC callback call rejected by positive list

This prevents optimizer functionality, which is critical for planning and execution processes.

  1. What is the best way to resolve this issue while keeping the system secure?
    • Should we configure the whitelist for required RFC callbacks?
    • Or is it acceptable to temporarily change the parameter value from 3 to 1?

2. What is the impact if we maintain the parameter value as 1?

  • Are there any major security risks beyond allowing RFC callbacks?
  • Will this affect other components or system stability?

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Impact of rfc/callback_security_method Setting on Opt...
entry.content:
Hello,

The recommendation is to set the rfc/callback_security_method parameter to 3 and adjust the allowlist per the CALLBACK_REJECTED_BY_WHITELIST dumps that are going to be generated.

The only impact the parameter has is on the RFC callback handling. You can read more about this on KBA 3349924 - Impacts of the parameter rfc/callback_security_method.

 

Best regards.

entry.title: Re: Manual Switch off of the distribution of manual accru...
entry.content:
Hi @HariBoyapati2 , 

To introduce more flexibility into your process, you could create two separate Settlement Document Types, one with distribution enabled and one without distribution, both linked to the same Settlement Process Type. This setup will not only give you better control over how settlements are processed but will also make it easier to analyze and report by document type.

Then, during manual settlement creation, you can simply select the appropriate document type based on whether distribution is needed for that scenario.

Also, depending on your use case, you may need to configure or adjust the ‚ÄúEntry Type for Manual Settlement‚Äù (MAN_SETTL_ENTRY_TYPE) in the Condition Contract Settlement Settings to ensure the system behavior aligns with your expected process flow.

Regards, 
Gauthier VICTOR

entry.title: Effortless SAPUI5 Patch Management: Introducing the New SAPUI5 Runtime Repository
entry.content:
For years, the MIME repository has been the standard location for storing SAPUI5 runtime artifacts for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. In contrast, the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition retrieves SAPUI5 from the cloud CDN. Although the MIME repository has served its purpose, many customers working with SAPUI5, especially system operators installing new SAPUI5 patches, face common challenges. These include poor performance, numerous manual steps, issues with transports, and risk of inconsistent states.

The good news is that SAP introduces the SAPUI5 Runtime Repository with the release of SAP S/4HANA 2025. This modern replacement overcomes these challenges and prepares you for the next generation of SAPUI5. To ensure efficiency for all customers, downports to all maintained lower releases are available, except for SAP S/4HANA 1809 using SAPUI5 1.38. You can access this repository through SAP Notes containing transport-based correction instructions (TCIs).

Let's explore how this new repository significantly enhances your workflow.

Performance Where It Matters

  • MIME Repository: SAPUI5 patch updates can take up to 2 hours. Loading debug-sources with sap-ui-debug=true can take up to 10 minutes.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Patch upgrades are approximately 20 times faster. During runtime, loading debug sources also occurs about 20 times faster. These improvements ensure smoother operations and faster response times.

From Complexity to Simplicity

  • MIME Repository: Handles more than 70,000 individual ABAP objects. This volume poses a risk of errors and inconsistent updates.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: All runtime content is bundled into just one ABAP object. This approach guarantees consistent updates and reduces operational risks.

Automation First

  • MIME Repository: Updates rely on custom, manual procedures, which increases the maintenance effort.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Uses SAP TCI Notes and comes with an automated process specifically for SAP S/4HANA cloud operations. This makes updates easier and more reliable.

Zero Downtime Deployments

  • MIME Repository: No support for zero-downtime deployments. This limitation might cause interruptions during system upgrades.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Fully supports online deployment with zero downtime. This feature ensures that SAPUI5 content remains continuously available, even during system upgrades.

Safe, Standardized Rollbacks

  • MIME Repository: Reverting patches can be error-prone, often requiring manual fixes and risking inconsistent system states.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Reverting SAPUI5 patches is fully supported. Runtime content is delivered as a single ABAP object, and the update process integrates with TCIs. Rollbacks are straightforward, consistent, and safe. This approach simplifies the validation of new patches: if issues arise, you can reliably revert to the previous stable state without lengthy manual intervention or risking inconsistencies across systems.

Future-Proof 

  • MIME Repository: Not compatible with multiple SAPUI5 versions.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Supports multiple SAPUI5 versions in parallel, making it ready for the future while ensuring backward compatibility.

Here's an overview of all the improvements:

Why This Matters

The move from MIME Repository to the new SAPUI5 Runtime Repository isn‚Äôt just a technical upgrade ‚Äî it‚Äôs a significant step toward:

  • Faster and safer patch updates.
  • Reduced operational effort.
  • Continuous availability.
  • Future compatibility.

If your organization uses on-premise landscapes and works with SAPUI5, it's time to embrace this change: the SAPUI5 Runtime Repository becomes automatically available with the current SAP S/4HANA 2025 release and in the latest support packages of all maintained SAP S/4HANA versions except SAP S/4HANA 1809.

Even if you do not want to upgrade to a new support package, you can still use the SAPUI5 runtime repository by installing SAP Note 3599156. If you have hesitated to install a new SAPUI5 patch, now is the time to try the new procedure and benefit from its efficacy and ease. Installing the latest SAPUI5 patches ensures your applications run efficiently today and are prepared for the future.

üëâHave you performed any SAPUI5 patch upgrades recently? What has your experience been like so far? To get started, refer to SAP Note 3599156.

entry.title: Re: Managing Compliance Register in SAP EHS: Boosting Transparency and Control
entry.content:
Hi @Hanish_ESG , 
Yes, it is applicable to all three obligation types Regulation, Permit, and Policy available in SAP EHS. The applicable requirements will pull all the requirements across all sub-levels, but it will ignore sub levels like appendices, guidelines, and citations during the applicability check.

entry.title: How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace
entry.content:
How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace

Introduction

The modern workplace has changed dramatically. Employees no longer rely solely on static intranets or scattered collaboration tools. Instead, they expect a connected, personalized experience that helps them cut through the noise and focus on meaningful work. Enter artificial intelligence (AI).

AI isn‚Äôt just another layer of technology- it‚Äôs rapidly becoming the backbone of digital workspaces. By surfacing the right information at the right time, automating repetitive tasks, and enabling smarter collaboration and self-service, AI is redefining how we work, learn, and engage every day.

With digital workspaces in SAP Build, these AI capabilities are already available today‚Äîhelping organizations deliver intelligent, personalized employee experiences out of the box

The Rise of AI in the Digital Workspace

For years, digital workspaces have been a central hub for business applications, documents, apps, and communications in one place. Useful‚Äîbut often overwhelming. Employees spent as much time searching for information as they did, acting on it.

Now, AI is filling the gaps. With intelligent copilots, content curation, and contextual answers, digital workspaces like SAP Build Work Zone have evolved from being a destination for information into an engine for productivity and engagement.

Core AI features available today in SAP Build digital workspaces

1. Chatbots & Virtual Assistants
With Joule, SAP‚Äôs AI copilot, workspace users can access information instantly. From answering HR questions to surfacing insights from reports, employees can rely on conversational AI to get what they need instantaneously.

Joule, SAP's AI copilot integrated into the digital workspace

2. Task completion with Joule Skills

One can enhance Joule capabilities by creating skills for it in Joule Studio. Connected with SAP systems and third-party applications, Joule can complete tasks like submitting time-off requests, approving workflows, or surfacing KPI dashboards‚Äîall from a single interface

  

3. Document Grounding Capabilities
Joule ensures information is both contextual and reliable when using workspace content to ground AI responses. For example, employees can ask ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs our travel policy in Europe?‚Äù and receive an AI response sourced directly from workspace content or SAP SuccessFactors policies when it is enabled as an AI source.

  

4. Content generation and summarization using generative AI
SAP Build leverages generative AI to help users create and refine content‚Äîwhether drafting announcements, summarizing updates, or suggesting language for a blog post‚Äîdirectly within the workspace.

  

 

 

 

 

Real-Life Examples in Action

  • Information access with grounded responses

Joule responds with answers grounded in the specific workspace content. Employees can query Joule with specific questions like ‚ÄúWhat is the holiday plan for next year in Germany" or ‚Äúhow can I apply for a sabbatical leave? Point me to the relevant file‚Äù.

  • Smart document summaries

Integrated AI services capture the highlights of a workspace document‚Äîpolicy highlights, key insights from data, or high-level overview of a blog.

  • Workflow Automation

From within SAP Build workspace, an employee can ask Joule to ‚Äúcreate a purchase order‚Äù or ‚Äúshow current pipeline metrics.‚Äù The copilot triggers the workflow in connected SAP systems, making productivity seamless.

  • Intelligent content curation

Users can easily create blog posts, feed posts or even knowledge articles in the workspace using the native AI features with simple prompts like ‚Äúcreate a workspace feed reminding members to fill their timesheet in a funny and casual tone‚Äù.

The Business Impact

  • Faster Information Access: Joule makes information searches 95% faster by surfacing insights and data instantly. Grounded insights reduce time spent searching for answers.
  • Reduced Manual Effort: Generative AI-assisted summarization and content creation free up employee time.
  • Better Governance: AI responses in SAP are backed by enterprise content, ensuring compliance and accuracy.

Preparing for the AI-Powered Workspace

Adopting AI in digital workspaces is not just about flipping a switch‚Äîit‚Äôs about preparing your organization:

  • Change Management: Train employees to adopt AI workflows and copilots in their daily work.
  • Governance: Define guardrails for AI-generated content, data privacy, and security.
  • Integration: Maximize value by connecting SAP Build with existing SAP and non-SAP applications, making copilots more powerful.

Conclusion

AI is no longer a future trend; it‚Äôs already embedded in the digital workspaces employees use today. With embedded AI and Joule, organizations don‚Äôt just imagine an intelligent workspace‚Äîthey experience it

By weaving AI into daily workflows‚Äîwhether through copilots, recommended learning, or curated content‚ÄîSAP Build helps organizations unlock productivity, agility, and engagement at scale.

Ready to take the next step?

Learn more about these capabilities and their implementation from the following resources:

  1. Joule integration with Work Zone
  2. SAP Build Work Zone Gets Even More Powerful with AI-Powered Capabilities
  3. Set Up Document Grounding | SAP Help Portal
  4. Integration With Document Grounding | SAP Help Portal
  5. Enabling AI Features | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Plan for migration of interfaces to SAP Cloud Integration(Int. Suite)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are in to aumotive industry,, This is regarding our ongoing plan to replace all the existing PO/PI instances with the shared SAP Cloud Integration(Int. Suite). As you know, we currently have Team A, Team B, Team C, , each using their own SAP PO/PI system, SAP backends, and individual integration teams. Say for example team A --> Financial;; team B --> Supply chain & Logistics ;; team C --> procurement ;;   Also each team has its distinct partner system or common partner system &  common plants between each two teams.  I have the following questions in terms of better architecture, implementation, design, stability, future proof, and operations etc.,

(i) Would it be beneficial for each team to migrate their ICOs to their own Pipeline concept iFlows.

(ii) Should we migrate interfaces system by system (or) plant by plant in a phased manner.

(iii) Standardization and Consistency, Operational Efficiency, Resource Management and Faster Migration (Long-Term), better integration patterns and reducing the complexity etc.

Regards,

Ramu.

If you want to run your both with scheduled trigger or API trigger, it is then you should keep your agent in Unattended mode. Please let me know, if that helps.

Johnson

entry.title: Re: [SAP Build Process Automation] Desktop Agent does not...
entry.content: Please check and see if the above comment is applicable for you as well. Automation launcher ---> Unattended automation (Agent in attended mode). Scheduled Trigger/ API Trigger--> Unattended automation (agent in unattended mode)

entry.title: Re: Depreciation Keys - Reducing Balance Method
entry.content:
HI @SamadDandiya 

Below table explains the issue with potential approach to solution.

Requirement / IssueECC BehaviorS/4HANA Public Cloud LimitationPublic Cloud Compliant SolutionHow to Configure (Expert Configuration)
Use of custom reducing-balance percentages (e.g., 33.33%, 26.7%, 13.33%)Maintained in Multi-Level MethodCannot create new multi-level methodsCreate new depreciation keys and maintain percentages directlyIn ‚ÄúDefine Depreciation Key‚Äù, enter DB rate (e.g., 33.33%) in Rate field
Multiple rates over different life periodsMulti-level method supports multi-layer %Cloud does not allow new multi-level layersUse Phase Control inside depreciation keyCreate Phase 1, Phase 2, Phase 3 with different DB rates
Switching rate after specific yearsMulti-level method supports this automaticallyCloud restricts layer creationConfigure Year-based Phase ChangesSet ‚ÄúFrom Useful Life Year‚Äù and ‚ÄúTo Year‚Äù per phase
Declining balance applied on APCBase value defined in multi-level methodNo new base value method allowedUse Standard Base Value = APC (method 01)In depreciation key ‚Üí Base Value: standard setting
Different % in each phase (ex: Yr 1‚Äì3 = 33.33%, Yr 4‚Äì8 = 26.7%, Yr 9+ = 13.33%)Multi-level method defines each levelCloud multi-level method lockedReplicate using Phase Control + DB ratesDefine three phases with specific % for each phase
Need to maintain client-specific custom %ECC allowed any %Cloud restricts creation only in multi-level methodYou can freely maintain % inside depreciation keyEnter any % (e.g., 26.7%) directly in the key
Requirement to replicate exact ECC valuesECC multi-level methods designed for custom rulesNot possible to duplicate multi-level methodCloud-aligned method using phases produces same valuesTest using ‚ÄúDepreciation Simulation‚Äù app

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Capitalization date must be earlier than or same as t...
entry.content:
Hello @Uddhav_B ,

Below is detailed explanation of your issue with possible solutions.

 

TopicDetailed ExplanationRequired Action / Recommended Fix
What the Error MeansSAP checks that every asset's Capitalization Date is ‚â§ Legacy Transfer Date (LTD). If even one asset has a later date, the entire upload fails. This rule is strict in Public Cloud and cannot be overridden.Ensure that all capitalization dates in the template are on or before the LTD configured in the migration settings.
Why the Error HappensThe migration template contains a capitalization date such as 2025-04-05 while the LTD is 2025-03-31. Even a 1-day difference causes a hard stop. SAP prevents importing assets with a historical inconsistency.Either adjust the asset date or move the LTD forward (e.g., from March 31 to April 30, 2025).
SAP Public Cloud LimitationThe Public Cloud prohibits changing the LTD in the asset record during upload. LTD is a global parameter and enforced for all migration objects. You also cannot disable or relax the validation.You must fix date mismatches either in configuration (LTD) or in the file. There is no system override option.
Dates Validated by the System (All Must Be ‚â§ LTD)SAP validates multiple fields, not just capitalization date: ‚Ä¢ Capitalization Date ‚Ä¢ In-Service Date ‚Ä¢ Acquisition Date ‚Ä¢ Posting Date ‚Ä¢ Quantity/technical capitalization date ‚Ä¢ Asset movement/APC date If ANY of these exceeds LTD, the error occurs.Review and correct all date fields in your migration template. Not just capitalization date.
Hidden Causes (Often Missed)‚Ä¢ Blank In-Service Date ‚Üí SAP interprets as 9999-12-31 ‚Ä¢ Excel auto-fills today‚Äôs date in Acquisition Date ‚Ä¢ AUC assets created after LTD ‚Ä¢ Sub-assets having different cap dates ‚Ä¢ Migration template copied from ECC with future datesManually enter correct values; do not leave blank dates; verify sub-assets individually.
Solution 1: Adjust Legacy Transfer DateIf your Customer has assets created after the planned LTD, you must move LTD forward. Example: LTD = 2025-03-31 but assets created in April ‚Üí error.Change LTD in configuration (or migration project) to match the latest asset capitalization date (e.g., set LTD = 2025-06-30).
Solution 2: Correct Template DatesIf the asset truly existed before LTD, but template dates are wrong or inconsistent, update them. Many customers mistakenly enter posting date instead of capitalization date.Modify the template so that Cap.Date, In-Service Date, Acquisition Date, and Posting Date are ‚â§ LTD.
Solution 3: Handle New Assets SeparatelyAssets genuinely created after LTD should not be migrated as legacy assets. They must be created as new assets in S/4HANA after go-live.Exclude such assets from migration. Create them using Manage Fixed Assets after go-live.
Solution 4: Change LTD Within Migration ProjectIn some versions, the LTD is visible under the Parameters tab of the migration object. You can set a new LTD here without changing configuration.Open Migration Cockpit ‚Üí Fixed Assets object ‚Üí Parameters ‚Üí Adjust LTD.
Solution 5: AUC-Specific HandlingAUC assets often have capitalization dates in the future because they are still under construction. SAP treats these dates strictly.Either adjust AUC dates to meet LTD or migrate AUC separately post go-live.
Checklist Before UploadBefore uploading, verify the following for each asset: ‚úÖ Capitalization Date ‚â§ LTD ‚úÖ In-Service Date ‚â§ LTD ‚úÖ Acquisition Date ‚â§ LTD ‚úÖ APC Movement Date ‚â§ LTD ‚úÖ No blank dates ‚úÖ AUC dates validated ‚úÖ Sub-assets have consistent datesPerform a full date audit of the template before uploading. This ensures that the upload succeeds on the first try.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Connecting the Facts: SAP HANA Cloud‚Äôs Knowledge Graph Engine for Business Context
entry.content: @pramodu - The Knowledge Graph Engine is a native offering in SAP HANA Cloud, and it allows you to store and query RDF knowledge graphs, meaning this is the persistence engine. The Knowledge Graph you are mentioning is the data, and it will be exposed to customers via Joule/Joule Agents, but under the hood. There is no announcement yet on how it will be directly be made accessible to end users, to get their hands-on to it.

We have the following set-up:

Action Definition: LLS_PRE_LTSD_EU_REQUEST -> Processing Details -> Printer -> Printer Determination 
Print Now = 'X' and
New Spool Request = ' '

Any idea, how to avoid the spool and get the pop-up to choose a printer to print?

Thanks,

entry.title: Receive by HU - Adjust Delivery line qty - Public Edition - EWM
entry.content:
Hi all,

I believe in 2408 SAP released the functionality for users in the Warehouse Monitor to receive at the HU level. However, if you receive any HU and put the pallet away, you cannot adjust the delivery quantity even though some quantity has not yet been received.

This is an issue as when receiving a container, we want to prevent clogging our dock with a whole container's worth of pallets before we verify the full delivery (or delivery line item). Receiving by HU allows us to verify at the pallet level. We should be able to put away this pallet. If at the back of the container, we realize we were shorted material, we should be able to take this quantity off the last (non-putaway) pallet.

 

In the below screenshot we can see that the putaway plan is partially completed (not fully putaway). Additionally, the quantity on the delivery line item is locked.

entry.title: Re: Mass Assets Scrapping - With posting on a specific ac...
entry.content:
Hi @G_hind01 ,

Try below options.

 

ScenarioApproachHow It WorksProsCons
1. Create Temporary Account Determination (AO90) Variant and Mass ScrapChange AO90 for specific Account Determination key (e.g., Z1) and assign these assets temporarilyAssign affected assets to a new Account Determination key using AS02 ‚Üí General Tab; then post scrapping via ABAVNNo manual posting; system drives correct G/LRequires master data change + careful controls
2. Use Manual Journal Entry After Scrapping (Reclass)Scrap assets normally using existing AO90 setup; then move gain/loss to another G/L via FB50 / F-02System posts gain/loss to AO90 G/L, then you manually post a reclassificationEasiest, safest, no config changeTwo-step process; more audit trail entries
3. Use Mass Transaction ABLDT (Post Scrap via Legacy Transfer Logic)Use ABLDT (with reason for scrapping) for one-time exceptional postings, specifying custom G/LCan override G/L because legacy transaction bypasses AO90No config changeNot recommended for operational use; audit sensitive
4. Use BAPI for Custom Posting (Z-program)Develop a small Z-program using BAPI_ASSET_RETIREMENT_POSTThe BAPI allows passing a custom gain/loss G/L in accounting tablesCan fully automate and specify G/LRequires development effort
5. Temporarily Change AO90 for the Account Determination and Switch BackChange AO90 for specific asset class ‚Üí perform mass scrapping ‚Üí revert AO90Mass changes possibleNo master data on assets changedVery sensitive ‚Äî affects all assets in the class; only safe if asset class is exclusive

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

Hello SAP Community! 

We are thrilled to announce that the speaker registration is now open for SAP Inside Track Gurugram 2025 

Event Registration details: üì¢ SAP Inside Track Gurgaon 2025 ‚Äì Third Edition! - SAP Community

Date:‚ÄØNovember 22, 2025 
Time:‚ÄØ9 AM - 5 PM IST‚ÄØ
Venue:‚ÄØSAP Labs India, Golf Course Rd, Suncity, Sector 54, Gurugram, Haryana 122002, India 

 

Topics for 2025

This year, we‚Äôre focusing on curated topic sessions around Business AI in SAP. We invite proposals in the following areas:

 SAP AI Strategy & Roadmap

 Embedded AI in SAP Solutions

 Building with SAP AI Agents

 Business AI Solutions (SAP)

 SAP Business Data Cloud

 SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)

 AI Innovations: Partners & Customers

If you have experience, insights, or success stories in any of these topics, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

 

 Why Speak at SAP Inside Track Gurgaon?

 

 Showcase Your Expertise ‚Äì Share your journey, technical know-how, or innovative projects with a highly engaged SAP audience.

 Network with Peers ‚Äì Build connections with fellow professionals, partners, and community leaders.

 Inspire and Be Recognized ‚Äì Position yourself as a thought leader within the SAP community.

 

 Speaker Registration is Now Open!

 Submit your proposal here: Speaker Registration for SIT Gurgaon 2025

Next Steps: Once you submit your proposal,
Step 1: Our expert team will go through your proposal and if it is shortlisted, we will contact you for more details.
Step 2: This will again be discussed internally with the experts and once shortlisted, we will inform you about the next steps ‚Äì like presentation format, social media advertisement etc.

We look forward to your valuable contributions and to seeing you at SAP Inside Track Gurugram 2025.

Best Regards,

SAP Community Gurgaon Core Team

3.The search procedure  was configurated in the movement type 641.

4.This characteristic was used.

5.A class was created, assigned 2 characteristics, and assigned to the material.

6.Class assigned to the material.

and the following data was indicated in plant data storage 1.

7.A sort sequence was created.

8.A second class was created.

 

9.A manage search strategies was created.

10. 

However, when I click the Batch determination button, the system displays the following message No search strategy could be found.

Note: 

The same process was performed for movement type 201 and it works there, so what special configuration do I need for movement type 641?

Thank you.

entry.title: ABAP BTP Environment - Application Log Objects - You are not authorized to display the specified log
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

In the ABAP BTP environment, we can create Application Log Objects, add messages, and save them successfully. However, our users currently lack the authorization to view the logs we‚Äôve created.

Example:

METHOD if_oo_adt_classrun~main.
    TRY.

        " Create log object
        DATA(lo_log) = cl_bali_log=>create( ).

        " Create and set header
        DATA(lo_header) = cl_bali_header_setter=>create( object      = 'ZZLOG'
                                                         subobject   = 'CONN'
                                                         external_id = '12345'
        )->set_expiry( expiry_date       = CONV d( cl_abap_context_info=>get_system_date( ) + 7 )
                       keep_until_expiry = abap_true ).

        lo_log->set_header( lo_header ).

        " Classic Message
        DATA(lo_msg) = cl_bali_message_setter=>create(
            severity   = if_bali_constants=>c_severity_error
            id         = 'ZZMSGCLS'
            number     = '001' ).

        lo_log->add_item( lo_msg ).

        " Save logs
        DATA(lo_log_db) = cl_bali_log_db=>get_instance( ).

        lo_log_db->save_log( lo_log ).

        " Get the handle
        DATA(l_handle) = lo_log->get_handle( ).

        out->write( |Log created: { l_handle }| ).

        " Read messages from handle
        lo_log = lo_log_db->load_log(
                   handle           = l_handle
                   read_only_header = abap_true
                 ).

        DATA(lt_items) = lo_log->get_all_items( ).

        LOOP AT lt_items ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_item>).
          out->write( <ls_item>-item->get_message_text( ) ).
        ENDLOOP.

      CATCH cx_bali_runtime INTO DATA(lo_cx_bali_runtime).

        out->write( lo_cx_bali_runtime->get_text( ) ).

    ENDTRY.

The method call:

        " Read messages from handle
        lo_log = lo_log_db->load_log(
                   handle           = l_handle
                   read_only_header = abap_true
                 ).

throws the exception with the text: You are not authorized to display the specified log

Does anyone know if there is any other way to read the logs?

Thank you,
Christian

entry.title: SAP numbering again ‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs jump!
entry.content:
It‚Äôs been a while, and I thought I was grown out of this, but I can‚Äôt get out of the habit.
I wonder why software component SAP BASIS has jumped up to version 8.16 recently.

Reminds me of my old blog posts on SAP numbering:

  • Why SAP ERP 6.0 EHP6 contains SAP BASIS 7.31 - SAP Community
  • SAP versioning, part 2 (why EHP7 contains SAP APPL... - SAP Community

Product version SAP S/4HANA 2025 (in short: 2025) is available since October 2025, and it contains software component version SAP BASIS 8.16. I must have been inattentive for a moment, since I was still considering it in the number range ‚Äú7-something‚Äù. OK, kids grow up and get older, but S/4HANA 2023 was based on 7.58 ‚Äì now it is on 8.16. This is a jump, isn‚Äôt it?

Subtracting 16 from 58 provides an interesting but misleading answer. Of course, you already see the real reason: my inattentive phase took too long, the distance between 2023 and 2025 is longer than before. SAP S/4HANA (Cloud Private Edition and on-prem) switched from a yearly to a bi-yearly release cycle, with three Feature Package Stacks in-between. But SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is delivered every quarter, and with this, it is eating up the numbers for the SAP BASIS versions.
As this is sorted out, let us look onto another component: the kernel. SAP Kernel 9.16 is used for 2025. Not a typo: SAP Kernel 9.16 and SAP Basis 8.16. 2023 uses SAP Kernel 7.93, and a move from 7.93 to 9.16 is even a bigger jump than the one SAP BASIS did!

Again, my inattention was probably the reason for my astonishment: I ignored SAP Business ByDesign (in short: ByD), another ABAP-based business solution from SAP that uses SAP Kernel and SAP BASIS. ByD has eaten up the kernel numbers in the 8-range, so 2025 jumped to ‚Äú9-something‚Äù. Jump 2 is clarified.

Let‚Äôs see what comes next to challenge my numbering skills.

entry.title: Workaround ToC when SolMan with CHARM system is in update Support Package
entry.content:
Hi

I need to perform a Support Package update in Solution Manager 7.2 using CHARM, and during the system downtime, I would like to continue performing Transport of Copy (ToC) requests in the ECC environment. However, I"m unsure if, once Solution Manager becomes available again, I will encounter problems with these requests, which already had change documents created in CHARM and were being managed by CHARM.

I read note 1528657 - Workaround when SolMan system is temporarily unavailable, but I think this situation only applies to a scenario where the Solution Manager Server is actually unavailable.

I tried to simulate a scenario by creating a change request document using CHARM. After that, I created a copy transport of the request with a profile using CHARM. From this point on, I didn"t touch CHARM anymore, assuming it was in the process of updating the Support Package. I adjusted the profile, added a new task to the request controlled by CHARM, released the task, created a copy transport, and added the task objects to the copy transport. When trying to release the task, I got error message number PU238 (An error occurred during the pre-export handling of the Order).

regards

entry.title: Re: Wait Time not available in production order operation...
entry.content:
Good day @RobC99 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references for more information.

Production Order (Version 2), Operations for Production Order (Version 2), CDS Views, APIs for Manufacturing

The entity set A_ProductionOrderOperation includes various key fields but not the field for Wait Time. The API focuses on order-execution data and doesn‚Äôt yet expose all scheduling- relevant parameters. The options provided by the Clean-Core approach is to either follow the analytical approach by using Released CDS views, Use Released API for scheduling data or use a Custom Logic BAdI.

To summarise, the current API does not expose the wait time field because it focuses on operational execution data. Consider using the CDS view I_ProdnOrdOpSchedgParams (includes manual overrides), which you can join with I_ProductionOrderOperation. If API access is required, you can implement a Custom Logic BAdI to append the field to the existing endpoint or monitor the upcoming API_PRODUCTION_ORDER_3_SRV which will natively include it.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Calculation of YTD Last year in the model - SAP ANALY...
entry.content:
@Miotisoa 

You can do it in 2 steps using story calculations.

First calculate the YTD by creating the restricted measure using dynamic date .

 

Now create another restricted measure using the previous restricted measure and now shift the date by previous year.

 

In Model level you can not nest YTD with any other dynamic time shift formulas. You can create the YTD in the model using YTD formula.

YTD(<measure>,[d/date])

Then use the story calculation  step 2 to restrict it to previous year.

Hope this helps !

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: SAC Planning : Cross model copy with hierarchies
entry.content:
@kiran_s611 

Better approach is to always have a common hierarchy setup within the dimension across model. So setup an identical hierarchy setup in both models and use that in the mapping rule of the cross model data copy to get consistent results.

entry.title: Training Alert! Exploring SAP Sales Cloud (V1) - New Learning Journey with Hands-on Practice systems
entry.content:
Announcing: Exploring SAP Sales Cloud (V1)
We‚Äôre excited to announce the official launch of a new intermediate learning journey on learning.sap.com.  Published by the CRM & CX Product Learning CoE team, this learning journey consolidates existing courses into an LJv4 ‚ÄúTimeline‚Äù format to deliver a structured, practical pathway for mastering SAP Sales Cloud (aka SAP Cloud for Customer).

Who this is for
Target audience: Business users, Admin users, and Consultants who want to expand their functional knowledge and technical skills with SAP Sales Cloud.

What you‚Äôll learn
By the end of this learning journey, you‚Äôll master the functionality and configuration of SAP Sales Cloud. Business users will explore real-world benefits and applications to optimize daily operations. Admins and consultants will dive into technical specifications and personalization. The curriculum is designed to equip you with the tools to leverage SAP Sales Cloud for maximum business impact and help you progress toward certification.

Featured topics and structure

  • Level: Intermediate learning journey
  • Sub-courses:
    • Discovering SAP Sales Cloud
    • Discovering SAP Sales and Service Cloud Administration
  • Includes a hands-on practice system so learners can apply concepts in a live environment
  • Structured timeline format to guide progression and prepare learners for certification

How to access
The learning journey is available now on learning.sap.com. The courses are FREE. The practice system requires an SAP Learning Hub license.

entry.title: Re: How to approach job profile builder for SF learning?
entry.content:
Hello @CassMontagner 

Hope you are doing well.

JPB in this specific scenario won't be possible to use. See below:

Assignment Profiles allow you to use User Profile information to build the target population. While attributes/Competencies are not associated with user profiles in Learning, JPB/TIH data won't be supported in the Assignment Profile rules.

As an alternative, other user related fields could be used to give you more granularity when building the profiles like Country/Region, Division, Job Location, Custom Fields, etc.

Hope this information helps you to move forward. Let me know if you have follow up questions.

-Geison

entry.title: Re: How to synchronize a big table in a replication syste...
entry.content:
I would recommend you specifically mention in this answer the specific scenario in which the 'Scenario 6' applies.

Namely, this approach is for the initial materialization of a table-level repdef. This approach would not work for a resync operation, nor would it work for an initial materialization if managing replication via Warm Standby (WS) or Multi-Site Availability (MSA).

For DBAs with a history of (Sybase) Repserver experience this is nothing new, but for new(er) Repserver DBAs the nuance (table-level repdef vs MSA vs WS) is often misunderstood in which case this answer could lead to some unwanted headaches and issues.

entry.title: Re: How to synchronize a big table in a replication syste...
entry.content:
A few caveats ...

  1. OP mentions the source and target are running under different OSs; while not an issue if we're talking big-endian-to-big-endian, or little-endian-to-little-endian, a cross-platform dump-n-load (eg, big-endian-to-little-endian) would require more details beyond 'dump the primary database'.
  2. OP is talking about materializing a single table so dropping and recreating an entire database repdef, followed by a full database dump, may be excessive.
  3. A database dump-n-load usually requires some advanced planning and/or advanced cleanup after the load is completed and before transactions are applied by the DSI; in particular, server level user/role ids must be synced with database level user/role ids, and any inter-database references (either by name or id) may need to be synced

entry.content: I couldn‚Äôt agree more with @Marian_Zeis. This is highly concerning. These kind of browsers have no place accessing enterprise systems. They are easily duped into accessing and relaying sensitive data via prompt injections (see https://simonwillison.net/search/?q=Comet&sort=date). And btw SAP sandboxes often contain plenty of data  that shall not be shared.

entry.title: How to integrate Cloud ALM with Integration Suite - Easy and Updated Steps
entry.content:
In this article, I will show how to integrate SAP Cloud ALM with SAP Integration Suite step by step. This setup allows you to connect your integration scenarios with Cloud ALM monitoring to gain full operational visibility and control.

SAP Cloud ALM is SAP‚Äôs cloud-based solution that helps you not only to implement a new system, but also monitor, operate, and optimize your SAP landscape. It provides tools for implementation tracking, process monitoring, alerting, and event management, all from a single cloud platform.

SAP Integration Suite is SAP‚Äôs enterprise integration platform that enables you to design, build, and manage integrations between SAP and non-SAP systems, both cloud and on-premise.

By connecting Integration Suite with Cloud ALM, you can:

  • Automatically monitor message and error data from integration flows to Cloud ALM.

  • Monitor end-to-end interfaces and exceptions in one central dashboard.

  • Simplify troubleshooting with unified alerts and logs.

  • Improve operational efficiency through proactive issue detection and resolution.

This integration helps facilitates operations, improve transparency, and enable a more reliable and connected SAP landscape.

I will divide into 2 parts: BTP Integration Suite Configuration and SAP Cloud ALM Configuration

Part 1 ‚Äî BTP Level Configuration (Integration Suite Side)

1. Access and Roles

  • Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit.
  • Make sure your Global Account and Subaccount are active.
  • Verify that Cloud Foundry is enabled and that you have the following roles:
    • Org Manager
    • Space Developer
    • Subaccount Administrator

2. Provision Integration Suite

  • Go to your Subaccount ‚Üí Instances and Subscriptions.
  • Ensure Integration Suite is provisioned.
    • If not: click Create ‚Üí Integration Suite ‚Üí select plan (standard or enterprise) ‚Üí Create.
  • Open the Integration Suite Launchpad to confirm access.

3. Create Service Instance

If you‚Äôre using the Integration Suite for API-based connections, ensure the Process Integration Runtime or Integration Suite API instance exists.

  • Go to: Service Instances ‚Üí Create ‚Üí Process Integration Runtime
  • Plan: api-access or standard
  • Confirm creation.

4. Create Service Key

To allow the Integration Suite to authenticate with Cloud ALM via OAuth:

  • Go to: Service Instances ‚Üí [your instance] ‚Üí Create Service Key
  • Copy and save:
    • clientid
    • clientsecret
    • tokenurl
    • url

Part 2 ‚Äî Cloud ALM Level Configuration

5. Access Landscape Management

  • In SAP Cloud ALM, go to
    Landscape Management ‚Üí Services & Systems ‚Üí Add New Service
  • Fill out All Properties which corresponds to your Cloud Integration

Click on save and the system shall be displayed according to below screen:

Click on Add Endpoint and fill out with the properties of your secret key JSON File
After adding the endpoint, go to Integration & Exception Monitoring ‚Üí Configuration and enable Data Collection for your system. Data will appear after a few minutes.

Congratulations, you finished the setup process!

Now, Go to Health Monitoring or Integration & Exception Monitoring and add the newly added system scope:

You may reproduce anything on the Integration Suite side in order to generate data, select the corresponding Time Frame and check the generated data being displayed in Cloud ALM.

Additional references: 
SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration)

Health Monitoring for SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration)
